REVIEW

Squarespace AI Review

After 38 hours of testing Squarespace Blueprint AI, I found it delivers gorgeous professional templates with AI guidance, but the editor has a steep learning curve and designs can feel cookie-cutter.

Updated: January 2025 - 38 hours of hands-on testing
| Score: 8.4/10 | How I Test

Quick Verdict

Squarespace AI is best for design-focused users who want professional, polished websites without hiring a designer. The Blueprint AI system guides you through creating a custom site.

The tradeoffs: Steeper learning curve than Wix, templates can feel similar, and you're locked into their ecosystem (no code export).

Ideal for photographers, designers, restaurants, and creatives who value aesthetics over total customization.

What I Tested

  • ✓ Blueprint AI setup - Design preference questionnaire
  • ✓ Template exploration - Tested 100+ templates
  • ✓ AI content generation - Copy, product descriptions, emails
  • ✓ Portfolio creation - Image galleries and layouts
  • ✓ Squarespace Commerce - E-commerce setup
  • ✓ Blogging features - Native blog testing
  • ✓ Customization - Editor complexity assessment
  • ✓ PageSpeed testing - Performance analysis

Testing Timeline

Day 1
Started with Squarespace Blueprint AI. Selected design preferences, got a customized site.
Day 2
Explored template library. 100+ professional templates - all gorgeous but similar aesthetic.
Day 3
Tested AI content tools. Generated website copy, product descriptions, email campaigns.
Day 4
Built portfolio site. Image galleries and layout tools are excellent.
Day 5
Set up e-commerce with Squarespace Commerce. Product setup was intuitive.
Day 6
Tested blogging features. Native blog is good but lacks WordPress flexibility.
Day 7
Tried customization. Editor is powerful but complex - took hours to learn basics.

Pros

  • ✓ Beautiful, professional templates
  • ✓ Squarespace Blueprint AI guides you
  • ✓ AI copy and image generation
  • ✓ Excellent for portfolios and visual sites
  • ✓ Built-in e-commerce is solid
  • ✓ Native blogging platform
  • ✓ 24/7 customer support

Cons

  • ✗ Steep learning curve for editor
  • ✗ Templates look similar (cookie-cutter)
  • ✗ No code export (vendor lock-in)
  • ✗ More expensive than competitors
  • ✗ PageSpeed scores are average (65-80)
  • ✗ Limited third-party integrations
  • ✗ Blogging less flexible than WordPress

Squarespace Blueprint AI

Squarespace Blueprint is their AI-powered onboarding system. Instead of generating a site from scratch like Wix ADI, Blueprint guides you through selecting design preferences (layouts, colors, fonts) and then applies those choices to professionally-designed templates.

The difference: Wix AI builds from scratch. Squarespace AI matches you to existing templates. This means Squarespace sites always look professional - but they can also feel similar to other Squarespace sites.

Best use case: If you want a gorgeous site without making design decisions, Blueprint is excellent. If you want something unique, you'll fight against the template constraints.

Design Quality: Squarespace's Strength

This is where Squarespace shines. Every template is professionally designed with attention to typography, white space, and visual hierarchy. My portfolio sites looked like I paid a designer $5,000.

The tradeoff: Because all templates follow Squarespace's design philosophy, many sites look similar. The "Squarespace look" is recognizable - clean, minimalist, image-heavy.

For restaurants, photographers, and creatives, this is perfect. For brands wanting to stand out visually, it's limiting.

How Squarespace Compares
